addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord,
e L. Burghley, Lord Highe Treasurer of England.

20 De
c
1592
M
r
Bodeley to my L./. His revoca
o
n.

page.lettertext:
fol.370r
May it please yo
r
good L. I have bin lately
disquieted w
t
a painfull infirmitie, w
ch
hath
put me out of course of writing to yo
r
L.
but
e truth is w
t
all, that
e affaires of this
contrey have not offered any mater. For
every Province is at rest, and
e meeting of
e states is adjorned for a moneth. There
are divers discoveries made to
Count Maurice
for
e easie surprising of
e towne of
Bolduke:
and divers are imploied, to take a diligent
information of every intelligence:
at if in
the trial they prove to be true, some attempt
may be given. In
e enemies contrey,
sins
e death of
e
D. of Parma
, there hath no
man undertaken to commaund in his place.
It is thought
e generallitie doth affect the
Count Mansfelde
: but yet
e
Councel of estate
doth give all directions: though
e Spaniard,
as they say, will be subject to neither. For
w
ch
the order of
e
King
is expected out of
Spaine.
It hath pleased her
Ma
tie
of late, to have a gratious consideration of
my privat estate, and of my long being heere,
and to cause my
La. of Warwicke
, and
M
r
Vicechamberlaine
, to give me notice of her pleasure,
That when Christmas is past, I shall have
license to returne. Whether it be
at yo
r
L. being then from
e court, have intelligence
fol.370v
of it sins, I am wholy uncertaine: but because
I am assured,
at I shall not be discharged,
unles yo
r
L. will vouchesafe to be a meane
that my licence may be signed by her Hig
es
I
am therfor to beseeche yo
w
w
t
all dutifull
humblenes,
at it may stand w
t
yo
r
good liking,
to favor me therein. For w
ch
I can not be more
bound, then I am already to yo
r
L. but it
will serve me in
e count of yo
r
honorable fa-
vo
rs
for a singular accesse.
And so with
hope in
at behalf of yo
r
comfortable answear,
I take my humble leave. From
e Hage.
De
c
20 1592.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho.Bodley.
